meanings.definition: The act of removing or altering material considered vulgar or offensive.
meanings.sent1: The bowdlerization of the movie made it appropriate for children to watch.
meanings.sent2: The bowdlerization of the book removed all the swear words.
meanings.sent3: The bowdlerization of the comedy show made it family-friendly and less shocking.
meanings.sent4: The bowdlerization of the painting took away its raw emotion and impact.
meanings.sent5: The bowdlerization of the song made it lose its edgy vibe and authenticity.

meanings.definition: The process of censoring or sanitizing content for a more acceptable audience.
meanings.sent1: The bowdlerization of the TV show toned down the violence for younger viewers.
meanings.sent2: The bowdlerization of the article removed any controversial statements.
meanings.sent3: The bowdlerization of the play made it suitable for all ages, even grandparents.
meanings.sent4: The bowdlerization of the speech made it bland and uninteresting.
meanings.sent5: The bowdlerization of the documentary made it lose its impact and authenticity.

meanings.definition: The practice of editing text to make it more suitable for public consumption.
meanings.sent1: The bowdlerization of the novel removed any scenes that could be deemed inappropriate.
meanings.sent2: The bowdlerization of the website ensured it was safe for all users.
meanings.sent3: The bowdlerization of the magazine article made it less scandalous and more mainstream.
meanings.sent4: The bowdlerization of the advertisement made it lose its original message and creativity.
meanings.sent5: The bowdlerization of the document made it lose its original voice and authenticity.
